source.8ffef6bf:
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib as plt
import seaborn as sns

df= pd.read_csv("../input/north-carolina-schools-performance/north-carolina-school-performance-data-QueryResult.csv")
df2 = pd.read_csv("../input/north-carolina-schools-performance/north-carolina-school-performance-data_1.csv", delimiter=";")

df= df.drop("hasstringsprogram", axis=1)
df2= df2.drop("hasstringsprogram", axis=1)
df['school']=df['school'].str.extract(r'\b(\w+)$', expand = True)
df['school'][(df['school']=='Sciences')|(df['school']=='College')|(df['school']=='CollegeHS')]='High'
df['School grade'] = 4 - df['grade'].astype('category').cat.codes
df2['school']=df2['school'].str.extract(r'\b(\w+)$', expand = True)
df2['school'][((df2['school']!='High')&(df['school']!='Middle')&(df['school']!='Elementary'))]='Other'
df2['School grade'] = 4 - df2['grade'].astype('category').cat.codes
df2['district'][(df2['district']=='Cumberland County Schools')]='Cumberland'
df2['district'][(df2['district']!='Cumberland')]='Schools in Other counties in NC'
df = df.rename(columns={'pctpassingeogtests': '% Passing End of Grade tessts', 'pctfreereduced' : '% Free/Reduced'}) 
df2 = df2.rename(columns={'pctpassingeogtests': '% Passing End of Grade tessts', 'pctfreereduced' : '% Free/Reduced'})
source.ef463b0a:
g= sns.pairplot(df, hue='school', diag_kind='kde');

handles = g._legend_data.values()
labels = g._legend_data.keys()
g.fig.legend(handles=handles, labels=labels, loc='upper left', ncol=3)
g.fig.subplots_adjust(top=0.92, bottom=0.08)
source.e0a0d46a:
#### Visualization
NOW I want to know if Fayetteville is a good city to raise kids in North Carolina. I want to check if school scores, the percentage of students who receive free or reduced cost meals or the performane of schools in Fayetteville is better or worse than other paarts of North Carolina.
source.4ba1107a:
## Conclusion

1- We can trust on school score, as higher school score is related to higher percentage of students that pass end of grade tests. 
2- In school where more students use free or reduced cost meal, more student are unable to pass the end of grade tests. It certainly has roots in serious society problems, but also can be infered that schools in high-poverty neighborhoods show dramatically lower performances.
3- In Fayetteville, High schools have better school grades and performance than Elementary and Middle schools, and Middle schools are the worsts.
4- Fayetteville has slightly higher poverty than average of North carolina
5- The chance of a student to pass the end of grade tests in Fayetteville is slightly lower than average of North carolina
6- average school grades of Fayetteville schools is about 50% (and school grade average is 2/4) and the schools in Fayetteville are just OK and can't be considered as good.

source.4537a651:
# Fayetteville North Carolina School System

Living in North carolina and having little kids, you have to always be worried about the quality of education your kids recieve and which public school is the best for their future. In this notebook, I have evaluated the pubblic schools in Fayetteville, North carolina (Cumberland County) and looking for trends affecting quality of education and therefore percentage of passing end of grade tests in different schools in my city. Then I compared Fayetteville school system to other schoos in North carolina.

## DataSets 

In this project I have used 2 dataset: 
- ../input/north-carolina-schools-performance/north-carolina-school-performance-data_1.csv
- ../input/north-carolina-schools-performance/north-carolina-school-performance-data-QueryResult.csv

Both these data sets have been downloaded from data.world website:

https://data.world/durhamnc/north-carolina-school-performance-data/workspace/file?filename=north-carolina-school-performance-data_1.csv

## Cleaning Data
Some simple cleanings needed to be done on raw datasets. And from the name of schools, I needed to categorize schools into 'Elementary', 'Middle' and 'High' school cathegories.
source.19820e2b:
#### Key takeaways
From the above Diagrams, the following colclusions can be infered.
1- We can trust on school score, as higher school score is related to higher percentage of students that pass end of grade tests. 
2- In school where more students use free or reduced cost meal, more student are unable to pass the end of grade tests. It certainly has roots in serious society problems, but also can be infered that schools in high-poverty neighborhoods show dramatically lower performances.
3- In Fayetteville, High schools have better school grades and performance than Elementary and Middle schools, and Middle schools are the worsts.
